body: Hey @clo-vis Thank you for the report! This is definitely a weird reaction, and I think our session_state preserves the value, which is rather weird. We've prioritized this in.

issue.title: Nested checkboxes keep displaying information

repository.name: streamlit
repository.description: Streamlit — A faster way to build and share data apps.

issue.body:
Hello everyone, 
I switched from version 0.76 to 0.84 (I tried as well with 0.82) and it seems that nested checkboxes (or radio buttons) keep trace of previous values despite the default value at False.

## Code snippet

```
import streamlit as st

def main():

    x_options = [0, 1, 2, 3, 4]
    checkbox_1 = st.checkbox('Option 1', False)

    if checkbox_1:

        st.write('you just selected Option 1')
        st.write('maybe now you want Option 2 ?')

        checkbox_2 = st.checkbox('Option 2', False)
        if checkbox_2:
            
            number_display = st.slider("choose the number of first x_options to display", min_value = 0, max_value=len(x_options), value = 2)
            for i in range(number_display):
                st.write(x_options[i])
                
if __name__ == "__main__":
    main()
```

**Steps to reproduce the bug**

1. Check the 'Option 1'
2. Check the 'Option 2' --> slider selection will be displayed for the demo
3. Uncheck 'Option 1' --> everything disappear
4. Check again 'Option 1' -->  the 'Option 2' checkbox is unchecked but the slider is still displayed

**Expected behavior:**

At step 4, as the checkbox 'Option 2' is unchecked I would expect to have no slider or information related to the 'Option 2'

**Actual behavior:**

At step 4, the checkbox 'Option 2' options are displayed, but disappear as soon as we click on them. Nevertheless it might be confusing for the user.

### Is this a regression?

yes, in version 0.76 the slider would not be displayed at step 4

### Debug info

- Streamlit version: 0.82 or 0.84
- Python version: 3.8.5
- Using PipEnv
- OS version: Big Sur
- Browser version: Brave Browser

Thanks for your help

The exact same issue as #389 is present in v0.84.2. I copied the minimal reproducible example and once again ran into the issue posted there.

My preferred solution would be to return an empty list.

issue.title: file_uploader with beta_expander

labels.name: status:confirmed
labels.description: Bug has been confirmed by the Streamlit team

repository.name: streamlit
repository.description: Streamlit — A faster way to build and share data apps.

issue.body:
### Summary

In a `beta_expander` a `file_uploader` widget's uploaded file information is disappearing from front-end after closed and re-expanded the expander


### Steps to reproduce

Code snippet:

```
import streamlit as st

with st.beta_expander('Config file', expanded=True):
  if st.file_uploader(''):
    print('file is uploaded')
```

1. Upload a file
2. Close the `beta_expander`
3. Open the `beta_expander`

**Expected behavior:**

The uploaded file information (file name, file size, and ability to remove attaching) is there

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6457941/125744323-b1f517d9-6360-4d8f-a9b1-c9848985b127.png)

**Actual behavior:**

The uploaded file information is missing

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6457941/125744358-a0235e69-7295-4322-b684-600774352432.png)

### Is this a regression?

probably no, an older version (0.76.0) streamlit neither works 

### Debug info

- Streamlit version: Streamlit, version 0.84.1
- Python version: Python 3.6.9
- No venv.
- OS version: Linux Mint 19.2 Tina
- Browser version: Mozilla Firefox 89.0.2 (64-bit)

issue.title: Check if widget value was changed before updating widget value

repository.name: streamlit
repository.description: Streamlit — A faster way to build and share data apps.

issue.body:
https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/issues/3534

**Description:**
In `maybe_set_state_value`, the second part of the function handles the case where we've already got the widget in session state, but the initial value has been changed.

Allow the change to the initial value, but before changing the widgets value in `_new_widget_state` that is returned to the script, check to make sure it wasn't changed by the user using `_widget_changed` function.

Updated the tests to capture this behavior.

**Questions
- What does returning `True` to the caller mean if this function conditionally changes or doesn't change numerous value?
- Should `test_maybe_set_state_value` be broken into multiple tests, or is it fine to have one unit test for the various behaviors of this function?

body: Can we expect this fix to be live in v0.85.1? Looks like it didn't make the cut for v0.85.0
Hi @kmcentush, yep that's the plan. We didn't want to include this fix at the same time as a release as huge as arrow, so it'll go out in 0.85.1 early next week.
@clo-vis , @kmcentush: This has been fixed in v0.85.1
